rock-001.name: River Pebble
rock-001.flavor: A smooth, gray stone, worn by water and time.

rock-002.name: Sharp Flint
rock-002.flavor: Used by early ancestors to make tools.

rock-005.name: Sandstone
rock-005.flavor: Feels like rough sand, because it is.

rock-006.name: Pumice
rock-006.flavor: The only rock that floats on water.

rock-007.name: Basalt
rock-007.flavor: The dark, dense rock that forms volcanic islands.

rock-008.name: Limestone
rock-008.flavor: Often contains tiny, fossilized sea creatures.

rock-009.name: Seraphinite
rock-009.flavor: A deep green stone with shimmery, feather-like patterns.

rock-010.name: Sea Glass
rock-010.flavor: Man-made glass, tumbled smooth by the ocean.

rock-011.name: Shale
rock-011.flavor: A fine-grained rock that smells like wet mud.

rock-013.name: Chalk
rock-013.flavor: A soft, white limestone formed from plankton shells.

rock-014.name: Brick Fragment
rock-014.flavor: A piece of a building, now returning to the earth.

rock-015.name: Cobblestone
rock-015.flavor: Worn smooth by countless footsteps and wagon wheels.

rock-016.name: Fieldstone
rock-016.flavor: A common rock found while plowing fields.

rock-017.name: Mudstone
rock-017.flavor: Hardened mud from an ancient river or lake.

rock-018.name: Asphalt Chunk
rock-018.flavor: A piece of 'urbanite' from a broken road.

rock-019.name: Glacial Till
rock-019.flavor: A random mix of clay, sand, and pebbles left by a glacier.

rock-020.name: Siltstone
rock-020.flavor: More coarse than shale, less coarse than sandstone.

rock-021.name: Small Geode
rock-021.flavor: A plain rock on the outside, full of crystals.

rock-023.name: Rose Quartz
rock-023.flavor: A cloudy pink crystal associated with love.

rock-027.name: Garnet
rock-027.flavor: A deep red gemstone, often found in riverbeds.

rock-028.name: Malachite
rock-028.flavor: Forms in beautiful, swirling green patterns.

rock-029.name: Sunstone
rock-029.flavor: Contains tiny copper flakes that glitter in the sun.

rock-030.name: Petrified Wood
rock-030.flavor: A tree that turned to stone over millions of years.

rock-031.name: Amber
rock-031.flavor: Fossilized tree resin. Sometimes traps insects.

rock-032.name: Abalone Shell
rock-032.flavor: The iridescent inner-shell of a sea snail.

rock-033.name: Tiger's Eye
rock-033.flavor: A golden-brown stone with a silky, shifting luster.

rock-034.name: Sodalite
rock-034.flavor: A rich, royal blue mineral, often veined with white.

rock-035.name: Lepidolite
rock-035.flavor: A lilac-gray mica. It glitters with a soft light.

rock-037.name: Hematite
rock-037.flavor: A heavy, metallic iron ore that can be polished to a mirror.

rock-038.name: Fordite
rock-038.flavor: Also 'Motor Agate'. Layers of old car paint from factories.

rock-039.name: Clear Quartz
rock-039.flavor: A common crystal prized for its clarity.

rock-040.name: Jasper
rock-040.flavor: An opaque, impure quartz, often red, yellow, or brown.

rock-041.name: Amethyst
rock-041.flavor: A brilliant purple crystal said to calm the mind.

rock-042.name: Lapis Lazuli
rock-042.flavor: A deep blue stone used for pigment by royalty.

rock-043.name: Peridot
rock-043.flavor: A bright green gem born in fire.

rock-044.name: Labradorite
rock-044.flavor: A dull gray stone that flashes with peacock-blue light.

rock-045.name: Aquamarine
rock-045.flavor: A pale blue gem, said to be the treasure of mermaids.

rock-046.name: Jade
rock-046.flavor: A tough, smooth green stone, highly valued for carving.

rock-047.name: Citrine
rock-047.flavor: A sunny, yellow-orange quartz. Often mistaken for Topaz.

rock-048.name: Fulgurite
rock-048.flavor: Hollow glass tubes formed by lightning striking sand.

rock-049.name: Azurite
rock-049.flavor: A vivid, deep blue mineral, often found with Malachite.

rock-050.name: Rhodochrosite
rock-050.flavor: A striking mineral with bands of pink and white.

rock-052.name: Kyanite
rock-052.flavor: Forms in flat, blade-like blue crystals.

rock-053.name: Smoky Quartz
rock-053.flavor: A clear quartz that has been naturally 'smoked' by radiation.

rock-055.name: Fluorite
rock-055.flavor: A cubic crystal that comes in green, purple, and blue.

rock-056.name: Desert Rose
rock-056.flavor: Clusters of gypsum that form in blade-like 'petals'.

rock-057.name: Ametrine
rock-057.flavor: A single crystal that is part Amethyst and part Citrine.

rock-058.name: Manganese Nodule
rock-058.flavor: A lumpy black rock from the deep ocean floor.

rock-059.name: Ice Crystal
rock-059.flavor: A perfectly preserved, ancient six-sided snowflake.

rock-061.name: Opal
rock-061.flavor: Catches the light with a fiery, internal rainbow.

rock-062.name: Meteorite
rock-062.flavor: A visitor from the stars. Feels heavy.

rock-063.name: Moonstone
rock-063.flavor: Shines with a soft, pearly, blueish light.

rock-064.name: Moldavite
rock-064.flavor: A deep green glass formed from a meteorite impact.

rock-065.name: Bismuth
rock-065.flavor: A brittle metal with an iridescent, geometric 'stair-step' look.

rock-066.name: Fire Opal
rock-066.flavor: A vibrant, translucent red-orange opal that glows like an ember.

rock-067.name: Peacock Ore
rock-067.flavor: Bornite that has tarnished to a brilliant, oily purple-blue.

rock-068.name: Larimar
rock-068.flavor: A rare blue mineral that looks like tropical water.

rock-069.name: Gneiss
rock-069.flavor: A metamorphic rock with distinct wavy bands.

rock-070.name: Pallasite
rock-070.flavor: A piece of meteorite with olivine crystals (Peridot) set in metal.

rock-071.name: Tektite
rock-071.flavor: Natural glass formed from the debris of a meteor strike.

rock-072.name: Watermelon Tourmaline
rock-072.flavor: A crystal that is pink in the center and green on the outside.

rock-073.name: Hydrothermal Vent
rock-073.flavor: A chimney of minerals formed by superheated water.

rock-074.name: Sunpetal Shard
rock-074.flavor: A crystal that is pleasantly warm to the touch.

rock-075.name: Moondrop
rock-075.flavor: Feels cool and calm, even on a hot day.

rock-076.name: Whisperwind Stone
rock-076.flavor: A porous, lightweight stone that hums faintly in a breeze.

rock-077.name: Tidal Heart
rock-077.flavor: A perfectly smooth stone that seems to pulse with a slow rhythm.

rock-078.name: Canyon Echo
rock-078.flavor: A layered sandstone that seems to hold a sound within it.

rock-079.name: Mammoth Tusk
rock-079.flavor: A fragment of ivory, preserved in the permafrost.

rock-080.name: Uvarovite
rock-080.flavor: A rare, bright green garnet that forms in tiny crystals.

rock-082.name: Rainbow Obsidian
rock-082.flavor: An obsidian variant that reveals hidden, colored layers.

rock-083.name: Emerald (Raw)
rock-083.flavor: A deep green beryl crystal, set in its matrix rock.

rock-084.name: Ruby (Raw)
rock-084.flavor: A red corundum crystal. Glows under blacklight.

rock-085.name: Sapphire (Raw)
rock-085.flavor: A blue corundum crystal, often found among river gravel.

rock-086.name: Alexandrite
rock-086.flavor: Changes color from green in daylight to red in candlelight.

rock-087.name: Black Opal
rock-087.flavor: The rarest type of opal, with a dark body and brilliant fire.

rock-088.name: Tanzanite
rock-088.flavor: A stunning blue-violet gem found only in one place on Earth.

rock-089.name: Painite
rock-089.flavor: Once considered the rarest mineral on the planet.

rock-090.name: Starmetal
rock-090.flavor: A piece of meteorite with a perfect, unnatural geometric pattern.

rock-091.name: Aurora Shard
rock-091.flavor: A crystal that contains a shifting, colorful light.

rock-092.name: Worldheart Fragment
rock-092.flavor: It beats with a slow, powerful, and ancient rhythm.

rock-093.name: Abyssalite
rock-093.flavor: A perfectly black stone that seems to absorb all light.

rock-094.name: Phoenix Ember
rock-094.flavor: A volcanic gem that never fully cools.

rock-095.name: Glacial Core
rock-095.flavor: A piece of ice from the dawn of time. It will not melt.

rock-096.name: Timeless Pebble
rock-096.flavor: It looks like a simple river pebble, but it feels... important.

rock-097.name: Lightning Opal
rock-097.flavor: An opal that seems to flash with an internal storm.

rock-098.name: Philosopher's Stone
rock-098.flavor: Is this... it? It looks like a piece of red brick.

rock-099.name: Chunk of the Moon
rock-099.flavor: A genuine lunar meteorite, ejected from the Moon's surface.

rock-100.name: Genesis Fragment
rock-100.flavor: A piece of stardust older than the sun itself.

rock-101.name: Jingle Bell Rock
rock-101.flavor: A round, metallic stone that jingles when shaken. (Winter Event)

rock-102.name: Sugar Stone
rock-102.flavor: A red and white banded crystal that looks like a candy cane. (Winter Event)

rock-103.name: Soot-Stained Pebble
rock-103.flavor: A lump of coal... or a warning? (Winter Event)

rock-104.name: Spooky Geode
rock-104.flavor: It's filled with black and orange crystals. (Halloween Event)

rock-105.name: Tombstone Shard
rock-105.flavor: A piece of weathered marble. Smells like graveyard fog. (Halloween Event)

rock-106.name: Spectral Quartz
rock-106.flavor: A cloudy quartz that seems to hold a ghostly face. (Halloween Event)

rock-107.name: Gourd-Stone
rock-107.flavor: A lumpy, orange rock that looks suspiciously like a tiny pumpkin. (Halloween Event)

rock-108.name: Heartstone
rock-108.flavor: A river pebble worn into a perfect heart shape. (Valentine's Event)

rock-109.name: Choco-Rock
rock-109.flavor: Looks like a chunk of chocolate, but it's just a rock. ...Right? (Easter Event)

rock-110.name: Painted Egg
rock-110.flavor: A perfectly oval stone painted with bright patterns. (Easter Event)

rock-111.name: Firework Crystal
rock-111.flavor: A dark crystal that explodes with light when you tap it. (New Year's Event)

rock-112.name: New Year Comet
rock-112.flavor: A small, icy fragment, here to mark a new beginning. (New Year's Event)

rock-113.name: Solstice Sunstone
rock-113.flavor: This stone is at its brightest on the longest day of the year. (Summer Event)

rock-114.name: Beach Ball Stone
rock-114.flavor: A perfectly round, colorful stone. Smells like sunscreen. (Summer Event)

rock-115.name: Lucky Clover Stone
rock-115.flavor: A slice of green agate with a perfect four-leaf pattern. (Spring Event)

rock-116.name: Raindrop Crystal
rock-116.flavor: A teardrop-shaped crystal that is always wet. (Spring Event)

rock-117.name: Two-Rock
rock-117.flavor: A pair of identical 'twin' pebbles. (Anniversary Event)

rock-118.name: Birthday Stone
rock-118.flavor: A piece of colorful confetti, fossilized into rock. (Anniversary Event)

rock-119.name: Autumn Leaf Jasper
rock-119.flavor: A piece of jasper with the colors of a falling leaf. (Autumn Event)

rock-120.name: Harvest Stone
rock-120.flavor: A 'corn' yellow agate, said to bring a good harvest. (Autumn Event)

rock-121.name: Conglomerate
rock-121.flavor: A lumpy rock made of other, smaller pebbles cemented together.

rock-122.name: Quartzite
rock-122.flavor: A very hard, non-foliated metamorphic rock. Was once sandstone.

rock-123.name: Gabbro
rock-123.flavor: A coarse-grained, dark rock. Similar to basalt but formed underground.

rock-124.name: Schist
rock-124.flavor: A metamorphic rock with flaky, parallel layers. Often glitters with mica.

rock-125.name: Chert
rock-125.flavor: A hard, fine-grained rock. Very similar to flint.

rock-126.name: Halite
rock-126.flavor: Natural rock salt. Tastes salty, but please don't lick it.

rock-127.name: Soapstone
rock-127.flavor: A soft rock, rich in talc. Feels slightly soapy to the touch.

rock-128.name: Gypsum
rock-128.flavor: A very soft mineral. Used to make plaster and drywall.

rock-129.name: Talc
rock-129.flavor: The softest known mineral on Earth.

rock-130.name: Dolomite
rock-130.flavor: A sedimentary rock, similar to limestone but with more magnesium.

rock-131.name: River Glass
rock-131.flavor: Like sea glass, but tumbled by a river's current.

rock-132.name: Concrete Chunk
rock-132.flavor: Modern-day conglomerate. Contains sand, gravel, and cement.

rock-133.name: Marble Chip
rock-133.flavor: A broken piece from a statue or countertop.

rock-134.name: Fossilized Leaf
rock-134.flavor: A simple leaf imprint, preserved in mudstone.

rock-135.name: Small Ammonite
rock-135.flavor: The fossilized, spiral-shaped shell of an ancient sea creature.

rock-136.name: Trilobite Cast
rock-136.flavor: The impression left behind by a long-gone trilobite.

rock-137.name: Loess
rock-137.flavor: A deposit of wind-blown silt. Very fine and dusty.

rock-138.name: Clay
rock-138.flavor: A sticky, fine-grained soil. Becomes hard when fired.

rock-139.name: Peat
rock-139.flavor: Spongy, decayed plant matter. An early precursor to coal.

rock-140.name: Lignite
rock-140.flavor: Brown coal. A soft, combustible rock.

rock-141.name: Anthracite
rock-141.flavor: Hard, shiny coal. Burns with very little smoke.

rock-142.name: Frost Heave Pebble
rock-142.flavor: A rock that was pushed to the surface by freezing ground.

rock-143.name: Ice-Wedged Schist
rock-143.flavor: A piece of schist that was split apart by freezing water.

rock-144.name: Tufa
rock-144.flavor: A porous limestone formed in hot springs or lake shores.

rock-145.name: Rhyolite
rock-145.flavor: A volcanic rock, high in silica. The volcanic equivalent of granite.

rock-146.name: Andesite
rock-146.flavor: A gray-to-black volcanic rock, named after the Andes Mountains.

rock-147.name: Beach Stone
rock-147.flavor: A perfectly smooth, flat stone, ideal for skipping.

rock-148.name: Porphyry
rock-148.flavor: An igneous rock with large crystals set in a fine-grained matrix.

rock-149.name: Serpentine
rock-149.flavor: A dull, waxy-feeling rock, often green or brown.

rock-150.name: Hornfels
rock-150.flavor: A hard, fine-grained rock 'baked' by nearby magma.

rock-151.name: Calcite
rock-151.flavor: A very common mineral. Can be orange, blue, green, or clear.

rock-152.name: Aragonite
rock-152.flavor: Forms in spiky, star-like clusters. Chemically identical to calcite.

rock-153.name: Selenite
rock-153.flavor: A clear, crystallized form of gypsum. Often forms in 'wands'.

rock-154.name: Milky Quartz
rock-154.flavor: A common, cloudy white quartz. Its color comes from tiny fluid inclusions.

rock-155.name: Agate
rock-155.flavor: A common type of chalcedony, known for its fine bands.

rock-156.name: Onyx
rock-156.flavor: A type of agate with straight, parallel bands of black and white.

rock-157.name: Bornite
rock-157.flavor: A copper iron sulfide mineral. Tarnishes to an iridescent purple.

rock-158.name: Chalcopyrite
rock-158.flavor: A brassy-yellow mineral. Often confused with Pyrite.

rock-159.name: Magnetite
rock-159.flavor: A naturally magnetic iron ore. Also known as Lodestone.

rock-160.name: Graphite
rock-160.flavor: A soft, carbon mineral. The 'lead' in your pencil.

rock-161.name: Sulphur
rock-161.flavor: A bright yellow mineral that smells like rotten eggs.

rock-162.name: Howlite
rock-162.flavor: A white, porous stone with gray veins. Often dyed to look like Turquoise.

rock-163.name: Unakite
rock-163.flavor: A mottled green and pink rock, composed of epidote and feldspar.

rock-164.name: Bloodstone
rock-164.flavor: A dark green jasper with small red, blood-like spots.

rock-165.name: Zebra Jasper
rock-165.flavor: An opaque stone with black and white stripes, like its namesake.

rock-166.name: Dalmatian Jasper
rock-166.flavor: A pale, spotted stone. The spots are black tourmaline.

rock-167.name: A'a Lava
rock-167.flavor: A type of lava that forms a rough, jagged, and clumpy surface.

rock-168.name: Pahoehoe Lava
rock-168.flavor: A type of lava that forms a smooth, billowy, or 'ropey' surface.

rock-169.name: Pele's Hair
rock-169.flavor: Fine strands of volcanic glass, spun by the wind from lava.

rock-170.name: Pele's Tears
rock-170.flavor: Small, black, teardrop-shaped bits of volcanic glass.

rock-171.name: Sand Dollar
rock-171.flavor: The bleached, fossilized skeleton of a flat sea urchin.

rock-172.name: Crinoid Stem
rock-172.flavor: A fossilized 'sea lily' stem. Looks like a small, stone bead.

rock-173.name: Shark Tooth
rock-173.flavor: A fossilized tooth, blackened by minerals over millions of years.

rock-174.name: Petrified Root
rock-174.flavor: The gnarled, stony remains of an ancient tree's root system.

rock-175.name: Blue Ice
rock-175.flavor: Glacial ice that has been compressed, pushing all the air bubbles out.

rock-176.name: Glacial Flour
rock-176.flavor: Fine-grained silt from glaciers grinding rock. It turns lakes turquoise.

rock-177.name: Cryoconite
rock-177.flavor: Powdery, windblown dust that settles on glaciers and melts holes.

rock-178.name: Permafrost Core
rock-178.flavor: A sample of soil that has been frozen for at least two years.

rock-179.name: Snowflake Obsidian
rock-179.flavor: Black obsidian with white, 'snowflake' patterns of cristobalite.

rock-180.name: Cave Pearl
rock-180.flavor: A small, round sphere of calcite formed by dripping water.

rock-181.name: Iolite
rock-181.flavor: A violet-blue gem. Vikings may have used it as a polarizing filter.

rock-182.name: Apatite
rock-182.flavor: Comes in many colors, but most known for its deep blue-green.

rock-183.name: Spinel
rock-183.flavor: A hard, glassy mineral. The 'Black Prince's Ruby' is actually a spinel.

rock-184.name: Zircon
rock-184.flavor: A brilliant gemstone. The oldest known mineral on Earth.

rock-185.name: Black Tourmaline
rock-185.flavor: A pitch-black, striated crystal. Also known as Schorl.

rock-186.name: Morganite
rock-186.flavor: A pale pink to peach-colored beryl. A cousin to Emerald.

rock-187.name: Chrysocolla
rock-187.flavor: A bright cyan-green copper mineral. Often found with malachite.

rock-188.name: Dioptase
rock-188.flavor: An intense, emerald-green copper mineral that forms small crystals.

rock-189.name: Variscite
rock-189.flavor: A minty-green mineral, often found in nodules.

rock-190.name: Adamite
rock-190.flavor: A zinc mineral known for its bright yellow-green, fluorescent crystals.

rock-191.name: Boulder Opal
rock-191.flavor: Thin seams of precious opal, still attached to their host rock.

rock-192.name: Fire Agate
rock-192.flavor: A type of agate that has a bubbly, iridescent 'fire' inside.

rock-193.name: Spectrolite
rock-193.flavor: A high-quality Labradorite from Finland with a full spectrum of color.

rock-194.name: Pietersite
rock-194.flavor: A 'stormy' looking stone with chaotic swirls of blue, gold, and red.

rock-195.name: Vanadinite
rock-195.flavor: Forms in brilliant red, hexagonal (six-sided) crystals.

rock-196.name: Wulfenite
rock-196.flavor: Forms in bright orange-red, square, tabular crystals.

rock-197.name: Crocoite
rock-197.flavor: A rare mineral that forms in fiery, reddish-orange needle-like crystals.

rock-198.name: Benitoite
rock-198.flavor: A rare, sapphire-blue gemstone that glows bright blue under UV light.

rock-199.name: Kunzite
rock-199.flavor: A pink-to-lilac colored spodumene crystal. Can fade in sunlight.

rock-200.name: Hiddenite
rock-200.flavor: A pale, emerald-green spodumene crystal. A 'sister' to Kunzite.

rock-201.name: Bumblebee Jasper
rock-201.flavor: A vibrant yellow, orange, and black stone. Its color comes from sulphur.

rock-202.name: Ocean Jasper
rock-202.flavor: A type of jasper known for its colorful, orb-like patterns.

rock-203.name: Mookaite Jasper
rock-203.flavor: A colorful jasper from Australia with swirls of deep red and yellow.

rock-204.name: Arctic Glass
rock-204.flavor: Sea glass that has been trapped in ice, giving it a unique, crackled look.

rock-205.name: Frozen Geode
rock-205.flavor: A geode with pale blue crystals that look like they're made of ice.

rock-206.name: Ice Cave Crystal
rock-206.flavor: A six-sided crystal of 'rock' ice, formed by slow freezing.

rock-207.name: Bioluminescent Rock
rock-207.flavor: A porous rock from the deep, home to a colony of glowing bacteria.

rock-208.name: Whale Fall Bone
rock-208.flavor: A piece of a whale skeleton, fossilized on the ocean floor.

rock-209.name: Tube Worm Fossil
rock-209.flavor: The stony, hollow casing of a deep-sea hydrothermal vent worm.

rock-210.name: Stalactite Tip
rock-210.flavor: The broken-off end of a 'ceiling icicle' in a cave.

rock-211.name: Charoite
rock-211.flavor: A rare, vibrant purple stone from Siberia with a swirling pattern.

rock-213.name: Eudialyte
rock-213.flavor: A rare, complex mineral known for its striking magenta-red color.

rock-214.name: Stibnite
rock-214.flavor: Forms in beautiful, metallic-gray, needle-like crystal clusters.

rock-215.name: Rhodonite
rock-215.flavor: A manganese mineral known for its rose-pink color and black veins.

rock-216.name: Ammolite
rock-216.flavor: An opal-like, iridescent fossil shell of an ammonite.

rock-217.name: Dioptase Geode
rock-217.flavor: A hollow rock lined with tiny, perfect, emerald-green Dioptase crystals.

rock-218.name: Chrysoprase
rock-218.flavor: The rarest variety of chalcedony. A translucent, apple-green stone.

rock-219.name: Gem Silica
rock-219.flavor: A rare, blue-green, highly translucent form of Chrysocolla.

rock-220.name: Euclase
rock-220.flavor: A brittle, typically blue beryllium mineral. Prized for its color.

rock-221.name: Phosphophyllite
rock-221.flavor: A very rare and delicate mineral, famous for its beautiful blue-green color.

rock-222.name: Taaffeite
rock-222.flavor: An extremely rare, purplish gemstone. Was mistaken for Spinel for years.

rock-223.name: Musgravite
rock-223.flavor: A cousin to Taaffeite, and one of the rarest gemstones in the world.

rock-224.name: Lightning Ridge Opal
rock-224.flavor: A famous Black Opal, with a red-on-black fire that is legendary.

rock-225.name: Stromatolite
rock-225.flavor: A layered rock, built by ancient bacteria. A living fossil.

rock-226.name: Martian 'Blueberry'
rock-226.flavor: A small, hematite-rich sphere, discovered on the surface of Mars.

rock-227.name: Trinitite
rock-227.flavor: A glassy green rock formed from desert sand fused by the first atomic bomb.

rock-228.name: Elysian Shard
rock-228.flavor: This fragment of pure light seems to hum with a gentle melody.

rock-229.name: Weeping Stone
rock-229.flavor: It's always damp, and seems to exude a feeling of gentle sorrow.

rock-230.name: Glowmoss Rock
rock-230.flavor: A common-looking forest rock, but the moss on it glows in the dark.

rock-231.name: Heart of the Mountain
rock-231.flavor: A crystal that pulses with a slow, steady light, like a beating heart.

rock-232.name: Fairy Stone
rock-232.flavor: A small, whimsical stone, naturally shaped like a tiny person or animal.

rock-233.name: Leviathan Scale
rock-233.flavor: A stone scale from a creature of unimaginable size. Found at the bottom of the sea.

rock-234.name: Kraken's Beak
rock-234.flavor: The fossilized, jet-black beak of a truly colossal, ancient squid.

rock-235.name: Frozen Spark
rock-235.flavor: A tiny, unmelting flame, trapped inside a perfect ice crystal.

rock-236.name: Sky-Iron
rock-236.flavor: A meteorite fragment that is lighter than it should be.

rock-237.name: Opalized Fossil
rock-237.flavor: A piece of ancient wood or bone, where every cell has been replaced by opal.

rock-238.name: Singing Stone
rock-238.flavor: A simple river rock that, when held, fills your head with a quiet song.

rock-239.name: Lodestar
rock-239.flavor: A magnetic stone that doesn't point North, but to a place you feel 'home'.

rock-240.name: Dragon's Egg
rock-240.flavor: A large, egg-shaped geode with deep red crystals and a warm exterior.

rock-241.name: Red Beryl
rock-241.flavor: Also called 'Bixbite.' An extremely rare, raspberry-red emerald.

rock-242.name: Grandidierite
rock-242.flavor: One of the world's rarest minerals. A beautiful, translucent blue-green.

rock-243.name: Jeremejevite
rock-243.flavor: A rare, complex borate mineral that forms in perfect, blue, hexagonal crystals.

rock-244.name: Cubic Zirconia
rock-244.flavor: A flawless, man-made diamond simulant. So perfect, it's unnatural.

rock-245.name: The Hope Diamond
rock-245.flavor: A copy... or is it? This deep-blue diamond feels heavy with history.

rock-246.name: Enigmatite
rock-246.flavor: This rock has no physical properties. It is a paradox in your hand.

rock-247.name: World-Egg
rock-247.flavor: A smooth, impossibly dense, perfectly oval stone. It contains everything.

rock-248.name: Shard of the Void
rock-248.flavor: It's not a rock. It's a piece of the nothing *between* the stars.

rock-249.name: Fallen Star
rock-249.flavor: It landed in a field, still glowing with a soft, warm light.

rock-250.name: Memory of the Forest
rock-250.flavor: A piece of amber containing a single, perfect drop of ancient water.

rock-251.name: First-Stone
rock-251.flavor: The archetype. The very concept of 'rock'. It's surprisingly plain.

rock-252.name: Last-Stone
rock-252.flavor: A rock from the end of time. It is perfectly smooth and has seen everything.

rock-253.name: Primordial Magma
rock-253.flavor: A piece of rock from the Earth's beginning, still liquid and impossibly hot.

rock-254.name: Tear of a God
rock-254.flavor: A teardrop-shaped crystal. It's unclear if it came from joy or sorrow.

rock-255.name: Chronos Crystal
rock-255.flavor: A quartz crystal that seems to tick. You can see your own reflection, but older.

rock-256.name: Dwarven Hearthstone
rock-256.flavor: A fist-sized ruby, intricately carved. It radiates a comforting, deep warmth.

rock-257.name: Elven Waystone
rock-257.flavor: A moonstone so clear it seems to be made of pure, liquid light.

rock-258.name: Mer-Queen's Pearl
rock-258.flavor: A pearl the size of an apple, with a luster that outshines the sun.

rock-259.name: R'lyeh Tablet
rock-259.flavor: A fragment of a non-Euclidean, oily green stone. It hurts to look at.

rock-260.name: The Philosopher's Stone
rock-260.flavor: It's... real. It's not a rock, but it's not *not* a rock. It smells like ozone.

rock-261.name: Petrified Lightning
rock-261.flavor: Not Fulgurite. This is an actual lightning bolt, frozen in time. It crackles.

rock-262.name: Core of the Iceberg
rock-262.flavor: A piece of ice that holds the 'soul' of a glacier. It speaks in a slow, grinding voice.

rock-263.name: The Rock of Sisyphus
rock-263.flavor: A chip from the boulder. It's impossibly heavy and feels like pure futility.

rock-264.name: The Blarney Stone
rock-264.flavor: A tiny piece. Holding it makes you feel strangely charismatic.

rock-265.name: Rosetta Stone (Copy)
rock-265.flavor: A souvenir from a museum. It's just granite, but it feels important.

rock-266.name: Aethelred's Crown Jewel
rock-266.flavor: A gem that was never meant to be found. It whispers promises of power.

rock-267.name: Babel-Stone
rock-267.flavor: A brick from the tower. When you hold it, all written words look like gibberish.

rock-268.name: The Un-Stone
rock-268.flavor: A perfect, rock-shaped hole in reality. Your hand passes right through it.

rock-269.name: My Pet Rock
rock-269.flavor: A simple gray stone with googly eyes. It's the best rock. (1975 Limited Run)

rock-270.name: Gemini's Core
rock-270.flavor: A flawless, man-made crystal that seems to contain infinite information.
